subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR

------=_NextPart_000_0064_01C9C25B.CC4F6EA0

" BTW, I don't do ghost hunts."

*SIGH* I know Frank...you make them come t=
o you instead ;)

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Sumption 
 =
 To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, April 20, 2009 8:51 PM
  Subj=
ect: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR






  The only thing I don't like is tha=
t the digital recorders don't have que and review funtions that tape decks =
have, you can't back up and re-listen to a voice, you have to go back to th=
e beginning, unless the file is copied the computer. 

   BTW, I don't do g=
host hunts. 

   Frank-S


  On Mon, Apr 20, 2009 at 8:01 PM, April Abercro=
mbie <april@...> wrote:





    Oh LOL!! No...you=
 are technically correct.

    There are 2 instruments that us ghost hunter=
s have in our arsenal that can go by the name of "DVR"; Digital Voice Recor=
der and Digital Video Recorder.

    To save some confusion, some of us ref=
er to a digital voice recorder as simply a voice recorder. I have gotten so=
 used to this term that I automatically think digital video recorder when I=
 hear DVR.

    I also have an Olympus digital voice recorder. I LOVE it. I=
n fact, I have had many over the years. I have had other brands too, but Ol=
ympus recorders are the best, as far as the affordable versions go.

    Ap=
ril

      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: purplespacefriend 
   =
   To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Monday, April 20, 2009 7:40 PM
=
      Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: A new DVR


      DVR, as in digital voice rec=
order. I'm not usded to using this new techno stuff, so maybe the terminolo=
gy is wrong. Anyway, I got it at Sams, $60, and it does have an external mi=
c jack. I made a line to mic level adapter so I can record directly from th=
e boxes. This one has built in USB connector, so it connects directly the P=
C. It records in WMA format, and that is easliy converted to mp3, or played=
 my windows media player. 

      F-S

      --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
, "April Abercrombie" <april@...> wrote:
      >
      > You have to tell h=
ow much and were to get one. I need a new DVR for my night vision cameras. =
I need to be able to hook an external mic to it as well, as the cameras do =
not have audio capability. I was going to buy the Radio Shack one as someon=
e suggested to me. Which would be fine, but I would really like to have USB=
 connection.
      > 
      > Does it have an internal harddrive?
      > 
=
      > April 


      > 
      > ----- Original Message ----- 
      > Fro=
m: Frank Sumption 
      > To: grassharp@yahoogroups.com ; evp-itc@yahoogro=
ups.com 
      > Sent: Sunday, April 19, 2009 9:43 PM
      > Subject: [EVP=
-ITC] A new DVR [7 Attachments]
      > 
      > 
      > [Attachment(s) fr=
om Frank Sumption included below] 
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > I bou=
ght a Radio Shack digital recored years, and never liked it much. I picked =
up an Olympus WS-21S this afternoon on a whim. I made a line to mic adapter=
, and did a couple box recordings. I don't know, might be better than tape.=
 I has the advantage of of built in USB connector, and it records in WMA fo=
rmat. 
      > 
      > I tried a short recording last night using the tone=
s in 51, I don't think they help. 
      > 
      > Frank-S
      >







=
